verses.verse: At that time, the Old Testament transcribers and Separatists from Greater Jerusalem came forward to Jesus, saying,
"Why do your students walk in violation of the tradition of the older men? You see, they are not washing their hands when they eat bread."
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "Why do you also walk in violation of the demand of God because of your tradition?
You see, God demanded, saying, (in Deuteronomy 5:16) 'Value your father and mother,' and, (in Exodus 21:17) 'The person who says bad things about a father or mother must pass away with death.'
But you say, 'Whoever says to the father or the mother, "Whatever you should have been benefited with from me is a contribution now,"
will not in any way even value his father or his mother.' And you terminated the demand of God because of your tradition.
Fakers, Isaiah nicely preached about you, (in Isaiah 29:13) saying,
'This ethnic group comes near to Me with their mouth and values Me with the lips, but their heart has itself far away from Me.
They worship Me in a futile way, teaching instructions that are people's regulations.'"
And after calling for the crowd, He said to them, "Hear and understand.
What goes into the mouth does not make the person shared, but what travels out of the mouth, this makes the person shared."
Then, after His students came forward, they said to Him, "Do you realize that when the Separatists heard the message, they were tripped?"
When Jesus answered, He said, "Every plant that My Father, the heavenly One, did not plant will be uprooted.
Leave them. They are blind guides of blind people. If a blind person guides a blind person, both will fall into a hole."
When Peter responded, he said to Him, "Define this illustration to us."
Jesus said, "Are you also still clueless?
Are you not yet aware that everything traveling into the mouth, takes up room in the belly, and is thrown out into the sewer?
But the things traveling out of the mouth come out of the heart, and those things make the person shared.
You see, out of the heart comes evil considerations, murders, cheatings on a spouse, sexual sins, thefts, lies from witnesses, hurtful comments.
These are the things that make the person shared, but the "to eat with unwashed hands" thing does not make the person shared."
And when Jesus went out from there, He took a back way into the parts of Tyre and Sidon.
And, look, when a Canaannite woman came out from those borders, she made a yell at Him, saying, "Show forgiving kindness to me, Master, Son of David. My daughter has a demon in a bad way."
But Jesus did not answer her a word, and when His students came forward, they were asking Him, saying, "Dismiss her because she is yelling behind us."
When Jesus answered, He said, "I was not sent out except to the sheep of Israel's house, the ones that have been lost."
When the woman came, she was bowing down to Him, saying, "Master, help me."
When Jesus answered, He said, "It is not nice to take the bread of the children and throw it to the little dogs."
But the woman said, "Yes, Master. You see, even the little dogs eat out of the crumbs, the ones falling off of their masters' table."
Then when Jesus responded, He said to her, "O ma'am, your trust is huge. It must happen to you as you want." And her daughter was cured from that hour.
And when Jesus walked somewhere else away from there, He went along the sea of Galilee. And after He climbed up into the mountain, He was sitting there,

and big crowds came forward to Him having with them crippled people, blind people, physically handicapped people, speech-impaired people, also many different people. And they tossed them beside Jesus' feet, and He healed them

in such a way for the crowds to be amazed seeing speech-impaired people speaking, physically handicapped people well, crippled people traipsing around, and blind people seeing. And they admitted that the God of Israel is magnificent.

After Jesus called for His students, He said, "I have sympathy on the crowd because already for three days they are still staying with Me and they do not have what they will eat. And I do not want to dismiss them with nothing to eat so that they will not be exhausted on the road."
And His students say to Him, "Where do we get so many loaves of bread from in an uninhabited place in such a way to make so big a crowd full?"
And Jesus says to them, "How many loaves of bread do you have?" The students said, "Seven and a few small fish."
And He gave the order to the crowds to settle down on the ground,
and when He took the seven loaves of bread and the fish, after He was thankful, He tore them and gave them to His students, the students to the crowds.
And they all ate and were full. And they picked up what was left over of the torn pieces: seven full big baskets.
The people eating were four thousand men, besides women and young children.
And after He dismissed the crowds, He climbed on board into the boat and went to the borders of Magdala.
